DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Magnetic Resonance Imaging With Additional Specified Image Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indication as to whether or not the magnetic resonance imaging included certain specified images.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Magnetic Resonance Imaging With Additional Specified Image
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._Added; extra; further._Clearly and explicitly stated._Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Concepts.definition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Property.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging With Additional Specified Image
Property.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:Added; extra; further.:Clearly and explicitly stated.:Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
